h4.img: To our families and community members,

div.h4: I am honored to work alongside such a phenomenal team of people in Barnwell School District 45 that have accomplished so much over the past few years. We have seen increased academic growth; our students are earning more college credits and industry credentials; the district has increased safety measures across our schools; we have received millions of dollars in instructional and facility grants; our technology department has put over 3,000 new technology devices and pieces of equipment into the hands of our students and teachers; and our district is in a much stronger financial position districtwide while still increasing salaries and modifying salary schedules to benefit out employees.

My goal is that we continue to work toward and accomplish the goals we set forth for our district in an effort to support our students and community, as well as improve the quality of life we all share. I'm very excited about the future of our district and feel grateful we have such a supportive and dedicated school board working toward one common goal - doing what is best for our students. Each year brings another set of opportunities which allow us to become stronger and more successful, and I look forward to that challenge in the upcoming year.

Looking forward to continued success,
Crissie Stapleton
Superintendent, Barnwell School District 45

div.p: Governor McMaster has announced that South Carolina public schools will remain closed the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We know this brings challenges to our families; however, we also know this announcement is made with our children’s best interest at heart. For our students and families, please continue working on your distance learning as you have been doing. We are so proud of the commitment of students, families, and staff during this time. As we plan for the closure of this school year, we will share specific details with you in the coming weeks.

The Warhorses Connect buses will be heading out to areas in our community today from 10:00am -2:00pm. Today’s stops for our Warhorses Connect Wi-Fi enabled buses will be Seven Pines Baptist Church in Snelling, Red Oak Fire Department, Sandy Hook Fire Station on Orchid Road, and Rosemary Baptist Church on Emerald Lane. Upon arrival, please park near the bus and log on for Wi-Fi access. No contact is necessary to utilize these services. We will continue adding more locations to our routes, rotating locations, and we will continue to share that information! Thank you for your continued support!
​Census Day—April 1—has come and gone but don’t worry, it was NOT the deadline to respond to the 2020 Census. In fact, you can respond now at https://go.usa.gov/xdKXZ.​

p.span: To our Barnwell 45 Families in PreK through 2
We hope that you all are doing well and looking forward to next week's Spring Break. As a reminder, our district Spring Break will be April 6
. Our distance learning packets for PreK through 2
grades and Special Services included 15 days of work, and the 15
day of learning is Tuesday, April 14

On Wednesday, April 15th we will have a drive-through pick-up for learning packets from 10:00 a.m. until 6:00 pm at the Barnwell Primary School horseshoe off Hagood Avenue. This will be provided for parents if you would like to receive a printed copy. Additional details will be shared prior to the pick-up day regarding that process. If you prefer receiving a digital download of the learning packet to print at home, please complete the

strong.a: Barnwell School District 45 Request for Electronic Copy of BPS and Special Services Instructional Packets

p.span: . A digital download will be emailed to the email address you provide on Tuesday, April 14th.
The first fifteen days of our Distance Learning Packets are due on Wednesday, April 15th. You have the following options for turning in packets:

li.span: You may drop off learning packets when you pick up new packets at Barnwell Primary School on Wednesday, April 15
. District administrators will be collecting the packets as you drive through.
You may choose to take photos of assignments (or scan the document) and submit via email to your child’s teacher or teachers.

p.span: Barnwell School District 45 is appreciative of your support, cooperation, and understanding during this challenging time. Thank you for working with us to provide your child with appropriate educational experiences even when we are not physically able to be in our schools. Thank you for all you do, and are continuing to do, for our most important resource – our children!

div.p: Message for Volunteers: We love our community! We have had so many people reach out to us to offer to help provide meals for our children within our community. We are so grateful and fortunate that our current staff has worked together to be able to continue providing these services at this time. With the uncertainty of the next several weeks, the state has provided a way for local citizens to sign up to volunteer within their communities with meal distribution. Read more...
Reminder: The Warhorses Connect WiFi buses will be out again today from 10am - 2pm. Please help us spread the word.

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: screen-shot-2020-03-19-at-1-20-18-pm.png

div.p: Barnwell School District 45 is committed to the safety, health, and well-being of our students, families, and staff. Although no cases of COVID-19 have been identified in our community at this time, we want to provide awareness for prevention strategies. As always, we routinely work closely with the South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control, the state entity charged with promoting and protecting the health of the public and the environment in South Carolina. Attached you will find information from DHEC regarding general information and steps for the prevention of viruses, such as COVID-19.

p.strong:
To enroll your child, you must have the following documentation:
1 - Completed Enrollment Form
2 - Completed Language Survey
3 - Certified birth certificate (long form)
4- Updated SC Immunization Record
5 - Guardian picture ID (with current residence listed)
6 - Two current DATED proofs of residence
(One proof must be current rental agreement or tax receipt; Other proof of residence may be: Electric Bill, Mortgage Statement, Water Bill or DSS Letter).

strong.span: For information regarding student enrollment during COVID school closures, please contact the school of enrollment:

p.strong: Barnwell Primary (Grades PK-3) - Principal Donna Selvey at 803-541-1343
Barnwell Elementary (Grades 4-6) - Principal Kay Gooding at 803-541-1287
Guinyard Butler Middle (Grades 7-8) - Principal Jessica Brabham-James at 803-541-1376
Barnwell High (Grades 9-12) - Principal Franklin McCormack at 803-541-1406

div.p: Make your donation to Teacher Forum by clicking on the Donate Now graphic above. You will be directed to the website of South Carolina Future Minds, the 501(c)3 dedicated to increasing private support for our state’s K-12 public schools.
Schools across our state use the South Carolina Future Minds website to collect online donations.

h4.span: Bus Driver Training classes will be offered by the Barnwell School District 45 Transportation Office for those interested in obtaining Bus Driver Certification. Participants must be 18 years of age and possess a valid South Carolina Driver’s License. For registration information and training dates please contact the District 45 Transportation Office at 803 541-1383.
